Gather-based Quantized Matrix Multiplication

mlx_gather_qmm.Rd

Performs quantized matrix multiplication with optional gather operations on inputs. This is useful for combining embedding lookups with quantized linear transformations, a common pattern in transformer models.

Usage

mlx_gather_qmm(
  x,
  w,
  scales,
  biases = NULL,
  lhs_indices = NULL,
  rhs_indices = NULL,
  transpose = TRUE,
  group_size = 64L,
  bits = 4L,
  mode = "affine",
  sorted_indices = FALSE,
  device = mlx_default_device()
)

Arguments

x

An mlx array (the input matrix)

w

An mlx array (the quantized weight matrix)

scales

An mlx array (the quantization scales)

biases

An optional mlx array (biases to add). Default: NULL

lhs_indices

An optional mlx array (indices for gathering from x). Default: NULL

rhs_indices

An optional mlx array (indices for gathering from w). Default: NULL

transpose

Whether to transpose the weight matrix. Default: TRUE

group_size

The group size for quantization. Default: 64

bits

The number of bits for quantization (typically 4 or 8). Default: 4

mode

The quantization mode, either "affine" or "symmetric". Default: "affine"

sorted_indices

Whether the indices are sorted (enables optimizations). Default: FALSE

device

Device to perform computation on. Default: mlx_default_device()

Value

An mlx array with the result of the gather-based quantized matrix multiplication

Details

This function combines gather operations (indexed lookups) with quantized matrix multiplication. When lhs_indices is provided, it performs x[lhs_indices] before the multiplication. Similarly, rhs_indices gathers from the weight matrix.

This is particularly efficient for transformer models where you need to look up token embeddings and then apply a quantized linear transformation in one fused operation.

See also

mlx_quantized_matmul()

https://ml-explore.github.io/mlx/build/html/python/nn.html
